comments: There is no clear or conclusive camera angle to determine if Ball (CHI) avoids making contact with Butler's (CHI) arm when he swipes down on his steal attempt.
LaVine (CHI) is in the paint for less than three seconds when he is imminently actively guarding an opponent.
Vucevic (CHI) establishes himself in a screening position in Vincent's (MIA) path and marginal contact occurs as he releases from the contact.
Vucevic (CHI) holds Adebayo's (MIA) arm and restricts his ability to secure the rebound.
Butler (MIA) maintains verticality as he defends DeRozan's (CHI) shot near the rim.
Vucevic (CHI) applies a stayed hand to Adebayo's (MIA) shoulder and marginal contact occurs as the ball bounces away from Adebayo.
DeRozan (CHI) cleanly ties up Butler (MIA), and a jump ball is correctly called.
Ball (CHI) keeps his heel elevated above the sideline and does not step out of bounds when he receives the ball.
Ball (CHI) is moving alongside Butler's (MIA) path and maintains a legal guarding position as he defends the driving shot attempt.
Tucker (MIA) goes to not through Caruso's (CHI) space during the inbound.
Caruso (CHI) is already in Tucker's (MIA) path when contact occurs and he absorbs the contact.
Tucker (MIA) makes contact with DeRozan's (CHI) arm, which affects his driving shot attempt.
Ball (CHI) applies a stayed hand to Lowry's (MIA) front and marginal contact occurs in the backcourt.
Ball (CHI) makes contact with the ball and any ensuing contact with Vincent (MIA) is considered incidental.
Jones Jr. (CHI) makes clean contact with the ball as he defends Lowry (MIA) on the perimeter.
LaVine (CHI) makes contact with Butler's (MIA) arm and affects his jump shot attempt.
DeRozan (CHI) and Adebayo (MIA) come together at the same spot and make clean contact with the ball as they pursue the rebound.
Lowry (MIA) maintains a legal guarding position in DeRozan's (CHI) path as he slips the contact and goes around Lowry on his driving shot attempt.
Vincent (MIA) and DeRozan (CHI) mutually engage and disengage and marginal contact occurs during the inbound.
Jones Jr. (CHI) is already in Butler's (MIA) path when contact occurs and he does not deliver contact.
Butler (MIA) cleanly deflects the ball away from Jones Jr. (CHI).
Jones Jr. (CHI) commits a take foul on Butler (MIA).
Tucker (MIA) cleanly deflects the ball away from DeRozan (CHI).
Tucker (MIA) is the last player to touch the ball before the ball goes out of bounds.  Possession is correctly awarded to Chicago.
Ball (CHI) commits a take foul on Vincent (MIA).
